mc.name: Ankh of Mishra
mc.oracleText: Whenever a land comes into play, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
mc.printedText: Ankh does 2 damage to anyone who puts a new land into play.

mc.name: Basalt Monolith
mc.oracleText:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Does not untap as normal during untap phase, but can be untapped at any time for 3 mana. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Black Lotus
mc.oracleText: {T}, Sacrifice Black Lotus: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Adds 3 mana of any single color of your choice to your mana pool, then is discarded. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Black Vise
mc.oracleText:
As Black Vise comes into play, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
mc.printedText: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during upkeep, black vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

mc.name: Celestial Prism
mc.oracleText: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: {2}: Provides 1 mana of any color. This use can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Chaos Orb
mc.oracleText: {1}, {T}: If Chaos Orb is in play, flip Chaos Orb onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. If Chaos Orb turns over completely at least once during the flip, destroy all permanents it touches. Then destroy Chaos Orb.
mc.printedText: {1}: Flip Chaos Orb onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. Chaos Orb must turn completely over at least once or it is discarded with no effect. When Chaos Orb lands, any cards in play that it touches are destroyed, as is Chaos Orb.

mc.name: Clockwork Beast
mc.oracleText:
Clockwork Beast comes into play with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
mc.printedText: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the untap phase, controller may buy back lost counters for 1 mana per counter instead of untapping Beast; this taps Beast if it wasn't tapped already.

mc.name: Conservator
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
mc.printedText: {3}: Prevent the loss of up to 2 life.

mc.name: Copper Tablet
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Copper Tablet does 1 damage to each player during his or her upkeep.

mc.name: Crystal Rod
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any blue spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

mc.name: Cyclopean Tomb
mc.oracleText:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target land. That land is a Swamp as long as it has a mire counter on it. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

When Cyclopean Tomb leaves play, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps until the end of the game, remove one of those mire counters.
mc.printedText: {2}: Turn any one non-swamp land into swamp during upkeep. Mark the changed lands with tokens. If Cyclopean Tomb is destroyed, remove one token of your choice each upkeep, returning that land to its original nature.

mc.name: Dingus Egg
mc.oracleText: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from play, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
mc.printedText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.

mc.name: Disrupting Scepter
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Play this ability only during your turn.
mc.printedText: {3}: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during your turn.

mc.name: Forcefield
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time target unblocked creature would deal combat damage to you this turn, prevent all but 1 of that damage.
mc.printedText: {1}: Lose only 1 life to an unblocked creature.

mc.name: Gauntlet of Might
mc.oracleText:
Red creatures get +1/+1.
Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds {R} to his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: All red creatures gain +1/+1 and all mountains provide an extra red mana when tapped.

mc.name: Glasses of Urza
mc.oracleText: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
mc.printedText: You may look at opponent's hand.

mc.name: Helm of Chatzuk
mc.oracleText: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {1}: You may give one creature the ability to band until end of turn.

mc.name: Howling Mine
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws a card.
mc.printedText: Each player draws one extra card each turn during his or her draw phase.

mc.name: Icy Manipulator
mc.oracleText: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
mc.printedText: {1}: You may tap any land, creature, or artifact in play on either side.

mc.name: Illusionary Mask
mc.oracleText: {X}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your hand into play face down as a 0/1 creature. Put X mask counters on that creature. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery. The creature's controller may turn the creature face up any time he or she could play an instant by removing all mask counters from it. This effect ends if the creature is turned face up.
mc.printedText: {X}: You can summon a creature face down so opponent doesn't know what it is. The X cost can be any amount of mana, even 0; it serves to hide the true casting cost of the creature, which you still have to spend. As soon as a face-down creature receives damage, deals damage, or is tapped, you must turn it face up.

mc.name: Iron Star
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any red spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

mc.name: Ivory Cup
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

mc.name: Jade Monolith
mc.oracleText: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
mc.printedText: {1}: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.

mc.name: Jade Statue
mc.oracleText: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Play this ability only during combat.
mc.printedText: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a creature for the duration of the current attack exchange. Can be a creature only during an attack or defense.
mc.flavorText: "Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock."Norin the Wary

mc.name: Jayemdae Tome
mc.oracleText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
mc.printedText: {4}: You may draw one extra card.

mc.name: Juggernaut
mc.oracleText:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
mc.printedText: Must attack each turn if possible. Can't be blocked by walls.
mc.flavorText: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

mc.name: Kormus Bell
mc.oracleText: All Swamps are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
mc.printedText: Treat all swamps in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. Swamps have no color; they are not considered black cards.

mc.name: Library of Leng
mc.oracleText:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.
mc.printedText: There is no limit to size of your hand. If a card forces you to discard, you may choose to discard to top of your library rather than to graveyard. If discard is random, you may look at card before deciding where to discard it.

mc.name: Living Wall
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
mc.printedText: Counts as a wall. {1}: Regenerates.
mc.flavorText: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

mc.name: Mana Vault
mc.oracleText:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.

At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.

{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Mana Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must pay 4 mana. If Mana Vault remains tapped during upkeep it does 1 damage to you. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Meekstone
mc.oracleText: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
mc.printedText: Any creature with power greater than 2 may not be untapped as normal during the untap phase.

mc.name: Mox Emerald
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 1 green mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Mox Jet
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 1 black mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Mox Pearl
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 1 white mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Mox Ruby
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 1 red mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Mox Sapphire
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 1 blue mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
mc.oracleText:
Nevinyrral's Disk comes into play tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
mc.printedText: {1}: Destroys all creatures, enchantments, and artifacts in play. Disk begins tapped but can be untapped as usual. Disk destroys itself when used.

mc.name: Obsianus Golem
mc.flavorText:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . ."
--Song of the Artificer

mc.name: Rod of Ruin
mc.oracleText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: {3}: Rod of Ruin does 1 damage to any target.

mc.name: Sol Ring
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Soul Net
mc.oracleText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: You gain 1 life every time a creature is destroyed, unless it is then regenerated.

mc.name: Sunglasses of Urza
mc.oracleText: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.
mc.printedText: White mana in your mana pool can be used as either white or red mana.

mc.name: The Hive
mc.oracleText: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp into play. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: {5}: Creates one Giant Wasp, a 1/1 flying creature. Represent Wasps with tokens, making sure to indicate when each Wasp is tapped. Wasps can't attack during the turn created. Treat Wasps like artifact creatures in every way, except that they are removed from the game entirely if they ever leave play. If the Hive is destroyed, the Wasps must still be killed individually.

mc.name: Throne of Bone
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any black spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

mc.name: Time Vault
mc.oracleText:
Time Vault comes into play tapped.
If Time Vault would become untapped, instead choose one - untap Time Vault and you skip your next turn; or Time Vault remains tapped.
{T}: Take an extra turn after this one.
mc.printedText: Tap to gain an additional turn after the current one. Time Vault doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it, you must skip a turn. Time Vault begins tapped.

mc.name: Winter Orb
mc.oracleText: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
mc.printedText: Players can untap only one land each during untap phase. Creatures and artifacts are untapped as normal.

mc.name: Wooden Sphere
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player plays a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: {1}: Any green spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

mc.name: Animate Dead
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead comes into play, if it's in play, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put into play with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to play under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves play, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
mc.printedText: Any creature in either player's graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. If this enchantment is removed, or at end of game, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. Target creature may be killed as normal.

mc.name: Bad Moon
mc.oracleText: Black creatures get +1/+1.
mc.printedText: All black creatures in play gain +1/+1.

mc.name: Black Knight
mc.oracleText: First strike, protection from white
mc.printedText: Protection from white, first strike
mc.flavorText: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

mc.name: Bog Wraith
mc.oracleText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
mc.printedText: Swampwalk
mc.flavorText:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

mc.name: Contract from Below
mc.oracleText:
Remove Contract from Below from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Discard your hand, add the top card of your library to the ante, then draw seven cards.
mc.printedText: Discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

mc.name: Cursed Land
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Cursed Land does 1 damage to target land's controller during each upkeep.

mc.name: Dark Ritual
mc.oracleText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Add 3 black mana to your mana pool.

mc.name: Darkpact
mc.oracleText:
Remove Darkpact from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
You own target card in the ante. Exchange that card with the top of your library.
mc.printedText: Without looking at it first, swap top card of your library with either card of the ante; this swap is permanent. You must have a card in your library to cast this spell. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

mc.name: Deathgrip
mc.oracleText: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
mc.printedText: {B}{B}: Destroy a green spell as it is being cast. This action may be played as an interrupt, and does not affect green cards already in play.

mc.name: Deathlace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to black. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Demonic Attorney
mc.oracleText:
Remove Demonic Attorney from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

Each player antes the top card of his or her library.
mc.printedText: If opponent doesn't concede the game immediately, each player must ante an additional card from the top of his or her library. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

mc.name: Demonic Hordes
mc.oracleText:
{T}: Destroy target land.

At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
mc.printedText: Tap to destroy 1 land. Pay {B}{B}{B} during upkeep or the Hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.
mc.flavorText: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

mc.name: Demonic Tutor
mc.oracleText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
mc.printedText: You may search your library for one card and take it into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

mc.name: Drain Life
mc.oracleText:
Spend only black mana on X.

Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.
mc.printedText: Drain Life does 1 damage to a single target for each B spent in addition to the casting cost. Caster gains 1 life for each damage inflicted. If you drain life from a creature, you cannot gain more life than the creature's toughness.

mc.name: Drudge Skeletons
mc.oracleText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
mc.printedText: {B}: Regenerates
mc.flavorText: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly--they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

mc.name: Evil Presence
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.
mc.printedText: Target land is now a swamp.

mc.name: Fear
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
mc.printedText: Target creature cannot be blocked by any creatures other than artifact creatures and black creatures.

mc.name: Frozen Shade
mc.oracleText: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"There are some qualities--some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
--Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

mc.name: Gloom
mc.oracleText: White spells and activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to play.
mc.printedText: White spells cost 3 more mana to cast. Circles of Protection cost 3 more mana to use.

mc.name: Howl from Beyond
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +X/+0 until end of turn.

mc.name: Hypnotic Specter
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
mc.printedText:
Flying
An opponent damaged by Specter must discard a card at random from his or her hand. Ignore this effect if opponent has no cards left in hand.
mc.flavorText:
"...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..."
--Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

mc.name: Lich
mc.oracleText:
As Lich comes into play, your life total becomes 0.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many permanents.
When Lich leaves play, you lose the game.
mc.printedText: You lose all life. If you gain life later in the game, instead draw one card from your library for each life. For each point of damage you suffer, you must destroy one of your cards in play. Creatures destroyed in this way cannot be regenerated. You lose if this enchantment is destroyed or if you suffer a point of damage without sending a card to the graveyard.

mc.name: Lord of the Pit
mc.oracleText:
Flying, trample (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach. If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.
mc.printedText:
Flying, trample
You must sacrifice one of your own creatures during upkeep or Lord of the Pit does 7 damage to you. You may still attack with Lord of the Pit even if you failed to sacrifice a creature.

mc.name: Mind Twist
mc.oracleText: Target player discards X cards at random.
mc.printedText: Opponent must discard X cards at random from hand. If opponent doesn't have enough cards in hand, entire hand is discarded.

mc.name: Nether Shadow
mc.oracleText:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow into play.
mc.printedText: If Shadow is in graveyard with any combination of cards above it that includes at least three creatures, it can be returned to play during upkeep for its normal casting cost. Shadow can attack on same turn summoned or returned to play.

mc.name: Nettling Imp
mc.oracleText: {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. If it doesn't, destroy it at end of turn. Play this ability only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
mc.printedText: Tap to force a particular one of opponent's non-wall creatures to attack. If target creature cannot attack, it is destroyed at end of turn. This tap should be played during opponent's turn, before the attack. May not be used on creatures summoned this turn.

mc.name: Nightmare
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness both equal the number of swamps its controller has in play.
mc.flavorText: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

mc.name: Paralyze
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze comes into play, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.
mc.printedText: Target creature is not untapped as normal during untap phase unless 4 mana are spent. Tap target creature when Paralyze is cast.

mc.name: Pestilence
mc.oracleText:
At end of turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Pestilence.

{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
mc.printedText: {B}: Do 1 damage to each creature and to both players. Pestilence must be discarded at end of any turn in which there are no creatures in play at end of turn.

mc.name: Plague Rats
mc.oracleText: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats in play.
mc.printedText: The Xs below are the number of Plague Rats in play, counting both sides. Thus if there are 2 Plague Rats in play, each has power and toughness 2/2.
mc.flavorText:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you..."
--Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

mc.name: Raise Dead
mc.oracleText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Return creature from your graveyard to your hand.

mc.name: Royal Assassin
mc.oracleText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
mc.printedText: Tap to destroy any tapped creature.
mc.flavorText: Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

mc.name: Sacrifice
mc.oracleText:
As an additional cost to play Sacrifice, sacrifice a creature.

Add to your mana pool an amount of black mana equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.
mc.printedText: Destroy one of your creatures without regenerating it, and add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to black creature's casting cost.

mc.name: Scathe Zombies
mc.flavorText: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

mc.name: Scavenging Ghoul
mc.oracleText:
At end of turn, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature put into a graveyard from play that turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.
mc.printedText: At the end of each turn, put one counter on the Ghoul for each other creature that was destroyed without regenerating during the turn. If Ghoul dies, you may use a counter to regenerate it; counters remain until used.

mc.name: Sengir Vampire
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Vampire gets a +1/+1 counter each time a creature dies during a turn in which Vampire damaged it, unless the dead creature is regenerated.

mc.name: Simulacrum
mc.oracleText: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.
mc.printedText: All damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. If this damage kills the creature it can be regenerated; even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature, you don't suffer any of it. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

mc.name: Sinkhole
mc.oracleText: Destroy target land.
mc.printedText: Destroys any one land.

mc.name: Terror
mc.oracleText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
mc.printedText: Destroys target creature without possibility of regeneration. Does not affect black creatures and artifact creatures.

mc.name: Unholy Strength
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +2/+1.

mc.name: Wall of Bone
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone.
mc.printedText: {B}: Regenerates
mc.flavorText: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

mc.name: Warp Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Warp Artifact does 1 damage to target artifact's controller at start of each turn.

mc.name: Weakness
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
mc.printedText: Target creature loses -2/-1; if this drops the creature's toughness below 1, it is dead.

mc.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
mc.printedText: Flying; {B}: Regenerates
mc.flavorText:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
--Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

mc.name: Word of Command
mc.oracleText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. That player plays that card with his or her own mana, but you make all decisions it calls for. The player is required only to use mana in his or her mana pool and mana that can be drawn from lands.
mc.printedText: You may look at opponent's hand and choose any card opponent can legally play using mana from his or her mana pool or lands. Opponent must play this card immediately; you make all the decisions it calls for. This spell may not be countered after you have looked at opponent's hand.

mc.name: Zombie Master
mc.oracleText:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.
All other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
mc.printedText: All zombies in play gain swampwalk and "{B}: Regenerates" for as long as this card remains in play.
mc.flavorText: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

mc.name: Air Elemental
mc.oracleText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

mc.name: Ancestral Recall
mc.oracleText: Target player draws three cards.
mc.printedText: Draw 3 cards or force opponent to draw 3 cards.

mc.name: Animate Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. It's still an artifact.
mc.printedText: Target artifact is now a creature with both power and toughness equal to its casting cost; target retains all its original abilities as well. This will destroy artifacts with 0 casting cost.

mc.name: Blue Elemental Blast
mc.oracleText: Choose one - Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.
mc.printedText: Counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.

mc.name: Braingeyser
mc.oracleText: Target player draws X cards.
mc.printedText: Draw X cards or force opponent to draw X cards.

mc.name: Clone
mc.oracleText: As Clone comes into play, you may choose a creature in play. If you do, Clone comes into play as a copy of that creature.
mc.printedText: Upon summoning, Clone acquires all normal characteristics, including color, of any one creature in play on either side; any enchantments on original creature are not copied. Clone retains these characteristics even after original creature is destroyed. Clone cannot be played if there are no creatures in play.

mc.name: Control Magic
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
mc.printedText: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. You can't tap target creature this turn, but if it was already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

mc.name: Copy Artifact
mc.oracleText: As Copy Artifact comes into play, you may choose an artifact in play. If you do, Copy Artifact comes into play as a copy of that artifact. It's still an enchantment.
mc.printedText:
Select any artifact in play. This enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; enchantment copy is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts.
Enchantment copy remains even if original artifact is destroyed.

mc.name: Counterspell
mc.oracleText: Counter target spell.
mc.printedText: Counters target spell as it is being cast.

mc.name: Creature Bond
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.
mc.printedText: If target creature is destroyed, Creature Bond does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.

mc.name: Drain Power
mc.oracleText: Target player plays a mana ability of each land he or she controls, then empties his or her mana pool. Add mana to your mana pool equal to the type and amount emptied from that player's mana pool this way.
mc.printedText: Tap all opponent's lands, taking all this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool into your mana pool. You can't tap fewer than all opponent's lands.

mc.name: Feedback
mc.oracleText:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Feedback does 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during each upkeep.

mc.name: Flight
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Target creature is now a flying creature.

mc.name: Invisibility
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by Walls.
mc.printedText: Target creature can be blocked only by walls.

mc.name: Jump
mc.oracleText: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target creature is a flying creature until end of turn.

mc.name: Lifetap
mc.oracleText: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: You gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.

mc.name: Lord of Atlantis
mc.oracleText: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
mc.printedText: All Merfolk in play gain islandwalk and +1/+1 while this card is in play.
mc.flavorText: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

mc.name: Magical Hack
mc.oracleText: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk.") (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
mc.printedText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one basic land type with another. For example, you can change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

mc.name: Mahamoti Djinn
mc.oracleText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: Of royal blood amongst the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

mc.name: Mana Short
mc.oracleText: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: All opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied.

mc.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
mc.flavorText: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

mc.name: Phantasmal Forces
mc.oracleText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Controller must spend U during upkeep to maintain or Phantasmal Forces are destroyed.
mc.flavorText: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

mc.name: Phantasmal Terrain
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain comes into play, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
mc.printedText: Target land changes to any basic land type of caster's choice. Land type is set when cast and may not be further altered by this enchantment.

mc.name: Phantom Monster
mc.oracleText: Flying
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh--but smile no more."
--Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

mc.name: Pirate Ship
mc.oracleText:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.
mc.printedText: Tap to do 1 damage to any target. Cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still tap. Pirate Ship is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

mc.name: Power Leak
mc.oracleText:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay up to {2}. For each one mana less than {2} he or she pays this way, Power Leak deals 1 damage to him or her.
mc.printedText: Target enchantment costs 2 extra mana each turn during upkeep. If target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, Power Leak does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.

mc.name: Power Sink
mc.oracleText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana; caster of target spell can't choose to let it be countered. If caster of target spell doesn't have enough mana, all available mana from lands and mana pool must be paid but target spell will still be countered.

mc.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
mc.oracleText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: Tap to do 1 damage to any target.
mc.flavorText: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

mc.name: Psionic Blast
mc.oracleText: Psionic Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.
mc.printedText: Psionic Blast does 4 damage to any target, but it does 2 damage to you as well.

mc.name: Psychic Venom
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
mc.printedText: Whenever target land is tapped, Psychic Venom does 2 damage to target land's controller.

mc.name: Sea Serpent
mc.oracleText:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
mc.printedText:
Serpent cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play.
Serpent is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.
mc.flavorText: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

mc.name: Siren's Call
mc.oracleText:
Play Siren's Call only during an opponent's turn and only before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At end of turn, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.
mc.printedText: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are destroyed at end of turn. Play only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

mc.name: Sleight of Mind
mc.oracleText: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell.") (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)
mc.printedText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. For example, you can change "Counters red spells" to "Counters black spells." Cannot change mana symbols.

mc.name: Spell Blast
mc.oracleText: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.
mc.printedText: Target spell is countered; X is cost of target spell.

mc.name: Stasis
mc.oracleText:
Players skip their untap steps.

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.
mc.printedText: Players do not get an untap phase. Pay {U} during your upkeep or Stasis is destroyed.

mc.name: Steal Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.
mc.printedText: You control target artifact until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target artifact was tapped when stolen, it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target artifact is put in its owner's graveyard.

mc.name: Thoughtlace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to blue. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Time Walk
mc.oracleText: Take an extra turn after this one.
mc.printedText: Take an extra turn after this one.

mc.name: Timetwister
mc.oracleText: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library and then draws seven cards. (Then put Timetwister into its owner's graveyard.)
mc.printedText: Set Timetwister aside in a new graveyard pile. Shuffle your hand, library, and graveyard together into a new library and draw a new hand of seven cards, leaving all cards in play where they are; opponent must do the same.

mc.name: Twiddle
mc.oracleText: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
mc.printedText: Caster may tap or untap any one land, creature, or artifact in play.

mc.name: Unsummon
mc.oracleText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
mc.printedText: Return creature to owner's hand; enchantments on creature are CARD ed. Unsummon cannot be played during the damage-dealing phase of an attack.

mc.name: Vesuvan Doppelganger
mc.oracleText: As Vesuvan Doppelganger comes into play, you may choose a creature in play. If you do, Vesuvan Doppelganger comes into play as a copy of that creature except for its color and gains "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have this creature become a copy of target creature except for its color. If you do, this creature gains this ability."
mc.printedText: Upon summoning, Doppelganger acquires all normal characteristics (except color) of any one creature in play on either side; any enchantments on the original creature are not copied. During controller's upkeep, Doppelganger may take on the characteristics of a different creature in play instead. Doppelganger may continue to copy a creature even after that creature leaves play, but if it switches it won't be able to switch back.

mc.name: Volcanic Eruption
mc.oracleText: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains destroyed this way.
mc.printedText: Destroys X mountains of your choice, and does X damage to each player and each creature in play.

mc.name: Wall of Air
mc.oracleText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: "This --'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

mc.name: Wall of Water
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {U}: +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

mc.name: Water Elemental
mc.flavorText: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

mc.name: Aspect of Wolf
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is equal to half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is equal to half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.
mc.printedText: Target creature's power and toughness are increased by half the number of forests you have in play, rounding down for power and up for toughness.

mc.name: Berserk
mc.oracleText:
Play Berserk only before the combat damage step.
Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. At end of turn, destroy that creature if it attacked this turn.
mc.printedText: Until end of turn, target creature's current power doubles and it gains trample ability. If it attacks, target creature is destroyed at end of turn. This spell cannot be cast after current turn's attack is completed.

mc.name: Birds of Paradise
mc.oracleText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Flying// Tap to add one mana of any color to your mana pool. This tap may be played as an interrupt.

mc.name: Camouflage
mc.oracleText:
Play Camouflage only during the declare attackers step.
This turn, instead of declaring blockers, the defending player chooses any number of creatures he or she controls and divides them into a number of piles equal to the number of attacking creatures. Assign each pile to a different attacking creature at random, and any creatures in that pile that can block the creature do so. (Piles can be empty.)
mc.printedText: You may rearrange your attacking creatures and place them face down, revealing which is which only after defense is chosen. If this results in impossible blocks, such as non-flying creatures blocking flying creatures, illegal blockers cannot block this turn.

mc.name: Channel
mc.oracleText: Until end of turn, any time you could play a mana ability you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Until end of turn, you may add colorless mana to your mana pool for 1 life each. These additions are played with the speed of an interrupt. Life spent this way is not considered damage.

mc.name: Cockatrice
mc.oracleText:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
mc.printedText:
Flying
Any non-wall creature blocking Cockatrice is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Cockatrice. Creatures destroyed in this way deal their damage before dying.

mc.name: Craw Wurm
mc.flavorText: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

mc.name: Elvish Archers
mc.oracleText: First strike
mc.printedText: First strike
mc.flavorText: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade"

mc.name: Fastbond
mc.oracleText:
You may play as many lands as you choose on your turn.

Whenever you play a land other than the first land of the turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.
mc.printedText: You may put as many lands into play as you want each turn. Fastbond does 1 damage to you for every land beyond the first that you play in a single turn.

mc.name: Fog
mc.oracleText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
mc.printedText: Creatures attack and block as normal, but none deal any damage. All attacking creatures are still tapped. Play any time before attack damage is dealt.

mc.name: Force of Nature
mc.oracleText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
mc.printedText:
Trample
You must pay {G}{G}{G}{G} during upkeep or Force of Nature does 8 damage to you. You may still attack with Force of Nature even if you failed to pay the upkeep.

mc.name: Fungusaur
mc.oracleText: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
mc.printedText: Each time Fungusaur is damaged but not destroyed, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
mc.flavorText: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

mc.name: Gaea's Liege
mc.oracleText:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves play.
mc.printedText: When defending, Gaea's Liege has power and toughness equal to the number of forests you have in play; when it's attacking, they are equal to the number of forests opponent has in play. Tap to turn any one land into a forest until Gaea's Liege leaves play. Mark changed lands with counters, removing the counters when Gaea's Liege leaves play.

mc.name: Giant Growth
mc.oracleText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +3/+3 until end of turn.

mc.name: Giant Spider
mc.oracleText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.
mc.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

mc.name: Grizzly Bears
mc.flavorText: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

mc.name: Hurricane
mc.oracleText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
mc.printedText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

mc.name: Ice Storm
mc.oracleText: Destroy target land.
mc.printedText: Destroys any one land.

mc.name: Instill Energy
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Play this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
mc.printedText: You may untap target creature both during your untap phase and one additional time during your turn. Target creature may attack the turn it comes into play.

mc.name: Ironroot Treefolk
mc.flavorText: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

mc.name: Kudzu
mc.oracleText:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.
mc.printedText: When target land is tapped, it is destroyed. Unless that was the last land in play, Kudzu is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on another land of his or her choice.

mc.name: Ley Druid
mc.oracleText: {T}: Untap target land.
mc.printedText: Tap Druid to untap a land of your choice. This action can be played as an interrupt.
mc.flavorText: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

mc.name: Lifeforce
mc.oracleText: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
mc.printedText: {G}{G}: Destroy a black spell as it is being cast. This use may be played as an interrupt, and does not affect black cards already in play.

mc.name: Lifelace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
mc.printedText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to green. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

mc.name: Living Artifact
mc.oracleText:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.
mc.printedText: Put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. During upkeep you may trade one counter for one life, but you can only trade in one counter each turn.

mc.name: Living Lands
mc.oracleText: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
mc.printedText: Treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. The living lands have no color; they are not considered green cards.

mc.name: Llanowar Elves
mc.oracleText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
mc.printedText: Tap to add 1 green mana to your mana pool. This tap can be played as an interrupt.
mc.flavorText: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

mc.name: Lure
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
mc.printedText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. If a creature has the ability to block more than one creature, Lure does not prevent this. If there is more than one attacking creature with Lure, defender may choose which of them each defending creature blocks.

mc.name: Natural Selection
mc.oracleText: Look at the top three cards of target player's library and put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
mc.printedText: Look at top three cards of any player's library. You may opt to rearrange those three cards or shuffle the entire library.

mc.name: Regeneration
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
mc.printedText: {G}: Target creature regenerates.

mc.name: Regrowth
mc.oracleText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
mc.printedText: Return any card from your graveyard to your hand.

mc.name: Scryb Sprites
mc.oracleText: Flying
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

mc.name: Shanodin Dryads
mc.oracleText: Forestwalk
mc.printedText: Forestwalk
mc.flavorText: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

mc.name: Stream of Life
mc.oracleText: Target player gains X life.
mc.printedText: Target player gains X life.

mc.name: Thicket Basilisk
mc.oracleText: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
mc.printedText: Any non-wall creature blocking Basilisk is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Basilisk. Creatures destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.
mc.flavorText: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

mc.name: Timber Wolves
mc.oracleText: Banding
mc.printedText: Bands
mc.flavorText: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

mc.name: Tranquility
mc.oracleText: Destroy all enchantments.
mc.printedText: All enchantments in play must be discarded.

mc.name: Tsunami
mc.oracleText: Destroy all Islands.
mc.printedText: All islands in play are destroyed.

mc.name: Verduran Enchantress
mc.oracleText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
mc.printedText: While Enchantress is in play, you may immediately draw a card from your library each time you cast an enchantment.
mc.flavorText: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

mc.name: Wall of Brambles
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
mc.printedText: {G}: Regenerates
mc.flavorText: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf."Conrad Aiken

mc.name: Wall of Ice
mc.oracleText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
mc.flavorText: "And through the drifts the snowy cliffs/ Did send a dismal sheen:/ Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken--/ The ice was all between."/Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

mc.name: Wall of Wood
mc.oracleText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
mc.flavorText: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

mc.name: Wanderlust
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Wanderlust does 1 damage to target creature's controller during upkeep.

mc.name: War Mammoth
mc.oracleText: Trample
mc.printedText: Trample
mc.flavorText: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

mc.name: Web
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures, though it does not gain the power to fly.

Enchant creature

mc.name: Disintegrate
mc.oracleText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.
mc.printedText: Disintegrate does X damage to one target. If target dies this turn, it is removed from game entirely and cannot be regenerated. Return target to its owner's deck only when game is over.

mc.name: Dragon Whelp
mc.oracleText:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. At end of turn, if this ability has been played four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp.
mc.printedText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn; if more than {R}{R}{R} is spent in this way, Dragon Whelp is destroyed at end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."
--Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

mc.name: Dwarven Demolition Team
mc.oracleText: {T}: Destroy target Wall.
mc.printedText: Tap to destroy a wall.
mc.flavorText: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

mc.name: Dwarven Warriors
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.
mc.printedText: Tap to make a creature of power no greater than 2 unblockable until end of turn. Other cards may be used to increase target creature's power beyond 2 after defense is chosen.

mc.name: Earth Elemental
mc.flavorText: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

mc.name: Earthbind
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
When Earthbind comes into play, if enchanted creature has flying, Earthbind deals 2 damage to that creature and Earthbind gains "Enchanted creature loses flying."
mc.printedText: Earthbind does 2 damage to target flying creature, which also loses flying ability.

mc.name: Earthquake
mc.oracleText: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
mc.printedText: Does X damage to each player and each non-flying creature in play.

mc.name: False Orders
mc.oracleText:
Play False Orders only during the declare blockers step.
Remove target creature defending player controls from combat. Creatures it blocked that no other creature blocked this combat become unblocked. You may have it block an attacking creature of your choice.
mc.printedText: You decide whether and how one defending creature blocks, though you can't make a choice the defender couldn't legally make. Play after defender has chosen defense but before damage is dealt.

mc.name: Fire Elemental
mc.flavorText: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

mc.name: Fireball
mc.oracleText:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
As an additional cost to play Fireball, pay {1} for each target beyond the first.
mc.printedText: Fireball does X damage total, divided evenly (round down) among any number of targets. Pay 1 extra mana for each target beyond the first.

mc.name: Firebreathing
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
--Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

mc.name: Flashfires
mc.oracleText: Destroy all Plains.
mc.printedText: All plains in play are destroyed.

mc.name: Fork
mc.oracleText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that it copies Fork's color. You may choose new targets for the copy.
mc.printedText: Any sorcery or instant spell just cast is doubled. Treat Fork as an exact copy of target spell except that Fork remains red. Copy and original may have different targets.

mc.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
mc.oracleText: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {R}: Goblins gain flying ability until end of turn. Controller may not choose to make Goblins fly after they have been blocked.
mc.flavorText: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

mc.name: Goblin King
mc.oracleText: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
mc.printedText: Goblins in play gain mountainwalk and +1/+1 while this card remains in play.
mc.flavorText: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

mc.name: Granite Gargoyle
mc.oracleText:
Flying
{R}: Granite Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Flying; {R}: +0/+1 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."
--The Underworld Cookbook by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar

mc.name: Gray Ogre
mc.flavorText: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

mc.name: Hill Giant
mc.flavorText: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

mc.name: Hurloon Minotaur
mc.flavorText: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

mc.name: Ironclaw Orcs
mc.oracleText: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
mc.printedText: Cannot be used to block any creature of power more than 1.
mc.flavorText: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

mc.name: Keldon Warlord
mc.oracleText: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
mc.printedText: The Xs below are the number of non-wall creatures on your side, including Warlord. Thus if you have 2 other non-wall creatures, Warlord is 3/3. If one of those creatures is killed during the turn, Warlord immediately becomes 2/2.

mc.name: Lightning Bolt
mc.oracleText: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
mc.printedText: Lightning Bolt does 3 damage to one target.

mc.name: Mana Flare
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of that type to his or her mana pool.
mc.printedText: Whenever either player taps land for mana, each land produces 1 extra mana of the appropriate type.

mc.name: Manabarbs
mc.oracleText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
mc.printedText: Whenever any land is tapped, Manabarbs does 1 damage to the land's controller.

mc.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
mc.flavorText: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

mc.name: Orcish Artillery
mc.oracleText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
mc.printedText: Tap to do 2 damage to any target, but you suffer 3 damage as well.
mc.flavorText: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

mc.name: Orcish Oriflamme
mc.oracleText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
mc.printedText: When attacking, all of your attacking creatures gain +1/+0.

mc.name: Power Surge
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controlled at the beginning of this turn.
mc.printedText: Before untapping lands at the start of a turn, each player takes 1 damage for each land he or she controls but did not tap during the previous turn.

mc.name: Raging River
mc.oracleText:
At the beginning of your combat phase, each opponent chooses "east" or "west" for each creature without flying he or she controls.

As you declare attacking creatures, choose "east" or "west" for each attacking creature.

"East" creatures can't block "west" creatures. "West" creatures can't block "east" creatures.
mc.printedText: When you attack, non-flying defending creatures must be divided as opponent wishes between the left and right sides of the River. You then choose on which side of the River to place each attacking creature, and attacking creatures can only be blocked by flying creatures or those on the same side of the River.

mc.name: Red Elemental Blast
mc.oracleText: Choose one - Counter target blue spell; or destroy target blue permanent.
mc.printedText: Counters a blue spell being cast or destroys a blue card in play.

mc.name: Roc of Kher Ridges
mc.oracleText: Flying
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and spread gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

mc.name: Rock Hydra
mc.oracleText:
Rock Hydra comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it.

For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.

{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.

{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
mc.printedText: Put X +1/+1 counters (heads) on Hydra. Each point of damage Hydra suffers destroys one head unless R is spent. During upkeep, new heads may be grown for {R}{R}{R} apiece.

mc.name: Sedge Troll
mc.oracleText:
Sedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.

{B}: Regenerate Sedge Troll.
mc.printedText: Troll gains +1/+1 if controller has any swamps in play. {B}: Regenerates
mc.flavorText: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.

mc.name: Shatter
mc.oracleText: Destroy target artifact.
mc.printedText: Shatter destroys target artifact.

mc.name: Shivan Dragon
mc.oracleText:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Flying, {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

mc.name: Smoke
mc.oracleText: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.
mc.printedText: Each player can only untap one creature during his or her untap phase.

mc.name: Stone Giant
mc.oracleText: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at end of turn.
mc.printedText: Tap to make one of your own creatures a flying creature until end of turn. Target creature, which must have toughness less than Stone Giant's power, is destroyed at end of turn.
mc.flavorText: What goes up, must come down.

mc.name: Stone Rain
mc.oracleText: Destroy target land.
mc.printedText: Destroys any one land.

mc.name: Tunnel
mc.oracleText: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated.
mc.printedText: Destroys 1 wall. Target wall cannot be regenerated.

mc.name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys

Trample
Two-Headed Giant of Foriys can block an additional creature.
mc.printedText:
Trample
May block two attacking creatures; divide damage between them however controller likes.
mc.flavorText: None know if this Giant is the result of aberrant magics, Siamese twins, or a mentalist's schizophrenia.

mc.name: Uthden Troll
mc.oracleText: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
mc.printedText: {R}: Regenerates
mc.flavorText:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da
hurt'll disappear."
--Traditional

mc.name: Wall of Fire
mc.oracleText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn.
mc.flavorText: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

mc.name: Wall of Stone
mc.oracleText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
mc.flavorText: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

mc.name: Wheel of Fortune
mc.oracleText: Each player discards his or her hand and draws seven cards.
mc.printedText: Both players must discard their hands and draw seven new cards.

mc.oracleText: Destroy all lands.

mc.name: Balance
mc.oracleText: Except the player who controls the fewest lands, each player sacrifices lands until all players control the same number of lands as the player who controls the fewest. Players discard cards the same way, then sacrifice creatures the same way.
mc.printedText: Whichever player has more lands in play must discard enough lands of his or her choice to equalize the number of lands both players have in play. Cards in hand and creatures in play must be equalized the same way. Creatures lost in this manner may not be regenerated.

mc.name: Benalish Hero
mc.oracleText: Banding
mc.printedText: Bands
mc.flavorText: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the hero.

Controller of target defender may distribute damage among attackers as desired. Play before defense is chosen.

mc.printedText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one red source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

Enchant creature

mc.name: Holy Armor
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature

mc.printedText: Target creature gains +1/+2.

mc.name: Island Sanctuary
mc.oracleText: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.
mc.printedText: You may decline to draw a card from your library during draw phase. In exchange, until start of your next turn the only creatures that can damage you are those that fly or have islandwalk.

mc.name: Karma
mc.oracleText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.
mc.printedText: Karma does 1 damage to player for each swamp player has in play. Damage occurs during player's upkeep. Affects both players.

mc.name: Lance
mc.oracleText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
mc.printedText: Target creature gains first strike.

mc.name: Mesa Pegasus
mc.oracleText: Flying, banding
mc.printedText: Flying, bands
mc.flavorText: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

mc.name: Northern Paladin
mc.oracleText: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
mc.printedText: {W}{W} and tap: Destroys a black card in play. Cannot be used to cancel a black spell as it is being cast.
mc.flavorText:
"Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort."
--The Book of Tal

mc.name: Pearled Unicorn
mc.flavorText:
"--'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before' --'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, --'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
--Lewis Carroll

mc.name: Personal Incarnation
mc.oracleText:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may play this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.
When Personal Incarnation is put into a graveyard from play, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.
mc.printedText: Caster can redirect any or all damage done to Personal Incarnation to self instead. The source of the damage is unchanged. If Personal Incarnation is destroyed, caster loses half his or her remaining life points, rounding up the loss.

mc.name: Purelace
mc.oracleText: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

Enchant creature

mc.printedText: Take a creature from your graveyard and put it directly into play. You can't tap it until your next turn.

mc.name: Reverse Damage

mc.printedText: All damage you have taken from any one source this turn is added to your life total instead of subtracted from it.

mc.name: Righteousness
mc.oracleText: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
mc.printedText: Target defending creature gains +7/+7 until end of turn.

mc.name: Samite Healer
mc.oracleText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
mc.printedText: Tap to prevent 1 damage to any target.
mc.flavorText: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

mc.name: Savannah Lions
mc.flavorText: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

mc.name: Serra Angel
mc.oracleText: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
mc.printedText:
Flying
Does not tap when attacking.
mc.flavorText: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

mc.name: Swords to Plowshares
mc.oracleText: Remove target creature from the game. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
mc.printedText: Target creature is removed from game entirely; return to owner's deck only when game is over. Creature's controller gains life points equal to creature's power.

mc.name: Veteran Bodyguard

mc.printedText: Unless Bodyguard is tapped, any damage done to you by unblocked creatures is done instead to Bodyguard. You may not take this damage yourself, though you can prevent it if possible.
mc.flavorText: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

mc.name: Wall of Swords
mc.oracleText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
mc.printedText: Flying
mc.flavorText: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

mc.name: White Knight
mc.oracleText: First strike, protection from black
mc.printedText: Protection from black, first strike
mc.flavorText: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.
